item.title: Five Key Charts to Watch in Global Commodity Markets This Week
item.description: Five Key Charts to Watch in Global Commodity Markets This Week Oil, wheat, copper, gold, and natural gas are all expected to be volatile this week, as traders await the release of key economic data and monitor the ongoing geopolitical situation.

item.title: China's Gold Binge Extends to Seventh Month as Holdings Climb
item.description: China continues to buy gold, adding 9.6 tons in May to bring its total holdings to 1,953.6 tons. This is the seventh consecutive month that China has added to its gold reserves. The People’s Bank of China (PBOC) has been buying gold since 2015, and its holdings have more than doubled in that time.

item.title: Stock Markets Down on Tuesday
item.description: Stock Markets Down on Tuesday The stock market was down on Tuesday as investors continued to worry about the war in Ukraine and the impact of rising inflation. The S&P 500 was down 0.5%, while the Nasdaq Composite was down 1.2%.
